card.game
Class WarHand

java.lang.Object
  card.game.Hand
      card.game.WarHand

public class WarHand
extends Hand

WarHand represents the state of a war player's hand at some point in the game.
The player has:
1) unplayed cards.
2) some (optional) down cards representing a state of war.
3) some (optional) up cards which decide the war winner.

upCards

java.util.LinkedList<Card> upCards
upCards determine the "war" winner. Usually just one up card during play, but maybe more than one during multiple wars

Method Detail

addCard

public void addCard(java.util.ArrayList<Card> c)
This should only be called during the initial deal.

Parameters:
c - - dealt card. Add it to the player's hand.

addCards

public void addCards(java.util.LinkedList<Card> cards)
This method should only be called following a war battle.

Parameters:
cards - - that were won. Add them as-is to the end of the player's hand.

isHandEmpty

public boolean isHandEmpty()
Does the player have any cards? If "no" then the player should be eliminated.

Returns:
true => the player has no cards.

playDownCard

public void playDownCard(int count)
A war has broken out and we should play 3 down cards. Since this might exhaust the cards in a player's hand, we don't let this happen so that the player can still play an up card.

Parameters:
count - - number of down cards. A variable in case the rules are varied.

playUpCard

public void playUpCard(WarRoundContext wc)
Just move the top hand card to the upCards pile. getUpCard() will return it.

Parameters:
wc -
